title: NO POTTING UP METHOD FOR TOMATO SEEDLINGS  - One Cup Method for Huge Tomatoes

tasks.task: Starting tomatoes from seed indoors using solo cups
subtasks: Obtaining solo cups and drilling holes in the bottom for drainage
Ensuring proper soil with seed starting mix and moistening it ahead of time
Filling solo cups halfway with moistened seed starting mix and packing it down
Planting two to three tomato seeds on the surface of the soil
Covering seeds with a quarter inch of soil and adding a layer of vermiculite
Watering through the bottom tray instead of top spraying, adding 2-3 inches of water daily
Using a grow light to provide sufficient light for seedling growth
Potting up the tomato plants when they grow above the cup rim by trimming lower leaves
Adding potting soil to fill the cup, allowing roots to grow into the soil from the stem
Transferring potted tomato plants to a sunny area like a garage or greenhouse for further growth
Continuously monitoring plant health and hardening off before planting outside during appropriate timing post-last frost.
